events.text: I already found the tray. Nothing left here.

Man had an ego the size of a parade float. Framed his Diamond-Studded SoundCloud Play Button. Damn thing was practically drilled into the wall to keep it from falling off, it was so heavy.
Wait a second... how did I know that?
I went over, and familiarity sunk in. My mind racing, not wanting to bring the weapon with me in case I was searched. Eyes swiveling wildly in my head, searching for a place to hide it, and seeing that heavy framed button, knowing nobody would think to check behind it.
I stepped slowly towards it, checked over my shoulder to make sure nobody could see, and my fingers knew what to do. Pulled the bottom of the frame away from the wall, and felt something slip and fall against them. Bingo.
Maybe I was a better criminal than I thought. I tugged it free from its hiding place.
Nope, bad idea. I'm taking it anyhow.
I stashed the tray in my coat, close to my heart. Right where the guilt should be.
